main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported over the eastern United States, primarily involving civilian pilots, on December 13-14, 1958.
interesting points: The sightings were reported by various pilots from different aircraft,All observations occurred during nighttime,The objects were described in various ways, including as large, brightly colored, and shooting stars,The sightings covered a wide geographical area, including New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Pennsylvania, and Ohio,Conclusions regarding the sightings included possibilities of balloons, aircraft, meteors, or unidentified objects.
location: New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Pennsylvania, Ohio, USA
witness description: civilian pilots and other observers in different locations
